rename.from: Language code with digits (e.g. "en-150") triggers Invalid Argument error in yiisoft/yii2/i18n/PhpMessageSource.php at line 138
rename.to: Language code with digits (e.g. "en-150") triggers Invalid Argument error in yii2/i18n/PhpMessageSource.php

body: Oh. Wow. What's your use case for it?

I am developing a new website in Craft CMS for a client – a company with subisidies in Europe and other parts of the world, but they aren't doing (much) business in the US. Their main language of communication is "international English", with British spelling and European formatting, but they are not British. en-150 is exactly matching for them (similarly, their Spanish website is mainly geared towards South America in general, which would call for es-419.)

I'd like to make use of the more specific "en-150" instead of just "en" because there is a chance that we will expand the website with a localized "en-US" version in the future. It's not a huge deal, but it would be nice to use the correct language codes since they were created exactly for this kind of situation.
That is totally valid. Would you please submit a pull request adjusting it? I'll merge it into master and it will be in the next release.

body: Full list of current codepages - https://www.localeplanet.com/icu/iso639.html. There are 5-6 with numeric code.

issue.title: [Bug] - Language codes with digits triggers "Invalid language code" Yii exception

repository.name: cms
repository.description: Build bespoke content experiences with Craft.

issue.body:
### Description

Language codes containing digits (i.e. "es-419", "en-150", "en-001" ) trigger an exception. This issue has been resolved in YII [`2.0.45`](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/milestone/67)

Creating this issue as a placeholder until the YII `2.0.45` is publicly available and can be updated in composer.json 

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34266521/148283447-73ba9063-b578-4a28-9a5d-b88deb4b2d54.png)


### References

- https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/19138
- https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/19150

body: Was this already released into an update? This bug got me as well. Can't find anything in the changelog
It's not released yet. It's on current master though.
